projects.title: Project 1: Basic Calculator
projects.body:
|||
- Description: A simple calculator that performs basic arithmetic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division).
|||
- Learning objectives:
    - Familiarization with basic Python syntax.
    - Use of variables, operators, and functions.
    - Input and output of data via console.
|||
- ‚è±Ô∏è Estimated time: 2-3 days

projects.title: Project 2: Number Guessing Game
projects.body:
|||
- Description: A game where the user must guess a random number generated by the computer, with hints about whether the number is higher or lower.
|||
- Learning objectives:
    - Generation of random numbers.
    - Use of loops and conditionals.
    - Creation of a simple user interface via console.
|||
- ‚è±Ô∏è Estimated time: 3-4 days
|||
- üõ†Ô∏è Technologies: Python
|||
- üí° Professional value: Demonstrates understanding of programming logic, control flow, and user input handling.
|||
- ‚ö° Difficulty: 5/10

projects.title: Project 3: To-Do List
projects.body:
|||
- Description: An application that allows the user to add, delete, and mark tasks as completed in a list. The information is saved in a text file.
|||
- Learning objectives:
    - Handling text files.
    - Use of lists and data structures.
    - Implementation of functions to manage the to-do list.
|||
- ‚è±Ô∏è Estimated time: 5-7 days
|||
- üõ†Ô∏è Technologies: Python
|||
- üí° Professional value: Demonstrates ability to manage data, organize code, and create a functional, albeit simple, application.
|||
- ‚ö° Difficulty: 6/10

projects.title: Project 4: Unit Converter
projects.body:
|||
- Description: A converter that allows converting between different units of measurement (e.g., Celsius to Fahrenheit, meters to inches).
|||
- Learning objectives:
    - Creation of functions with parameters and return values.
    - Exception handling.
    - Design of a more robust user interface.
|||
- ‚è±Ô∏è Estimated time: 7-10 days
|||
- üõ†Ô∏è Technologies: Python
|||
- üí° Professional value: Demonstrates ability to design a modular application, handling different types of data and possible errors.
|||
- ‚ö° Difficulty: 7/10

projects.title: Project 5: Book Management Application
projects.body:
|||
- Description: A simple application to manage a personal library, allowing adding, deleting, searching, and listing books with title, author, and ISBN. The data is stored in a file (e.g., CSV or JSON).
|||
- Learning objectives:
    - Working with simple databases (CSV or JSON files).
    - Organizing code into modules or classes (introduction to object-oriented programming).
    - Handling structured data.
|||
- ‚è±Ô∏è Estimated time: 10-14 days
|||
- üõ†Ô∏è Technologies: Python
|||
- üí° Professional value: Demonstrates ability to manage a more complex project, including design, implementation, and handling of persistent data.
|||
- ‚ö° Difficulty: 8/10
